data.title: Excellent meal
data.text: Quaint little spot in old town Plano. Small an cozy. Our waitress was very attentive. The food came in a reasonable amount of time and the portions were more than ample. Enjoyed it very much and would definitely return

data.title: Great food.  Located in Historic downtown Plano
data.text: This was a really good lunch outing for our lunch group.  It is located in Historic Downtown Plano.  They have great food and nice quaint atmosphere.  We all enjoyed our food and will be going back again.  It's not a big place and always check on what days they are closed to make sure they are open and that you have a great time.  This place is great for eastern European food.

data.title: Fantastic Evening!
data.text: We celebrated a dear friend's birthday at Jorgs, and had the most delightful time!! The food is excellent, very authentic. We lived in Germany for some years, and the tastes and ambiance at Jorgs was a lovely trip down memory lane. Best beer I've had since returning to the States. Staff is friendly and attentive without being intrusive. Jorgs should not be missed!!

data.title: Excellent Vienniese dining
data.text: Jorg's dining and menu selection is simply fantastic.  Repeat ... it is simple and very representative of Vienna/Germany. A great menu and some damn good beers. Jorg is great to chat with and his staff is excellent. Great dining in Old Town Plano.

data.title: Love this Place!
data.text: I have been a customer of Jorg's for many years and the quality of the food hasn't changed at all!  My favorite dish is the Paprika Chicken.  The best sauce around!  My last visit was very pleasant.  We had the most delightful waitress.  She was pleasant, happy, and very willing to make our experience delightful!  Jorg's has the very best cappuccino around and the desserts are wonderful too!

data.title: Like Being in Austria!
data.text: Hard to believe that hidden away in the middle of the small historic downtown area of Plano there is an authentic Austrian/German eatery. Between the waitstaff clothed in Austrian garb, the vast array of European beer choices, the best schnitzel and sauerkraut, to the distinctive German accents of some staff members, you will not find it hard to imagine yourself at a cafe in the middle of Vienna. The food is excellent and in our visits there we have tried various menu offerings and have not yet found something we did not absolutely love. Be prepared to wait for a table on weekends due to the popularity of this place and their limited open days. Service is friendly and efficient. There is a very small bar area if you just want to stop in and taste the best of Munich's Oktoberfest winners or the always dependably smooth Stiegl. Take a trip to Europe without taking your passport - just take an empty stomach!

data.title: Great place in downtown Plano!
data.text: We've seen this place for years and finally decided to stop in. What a nice place! Smallish but very enjoyable. Our waitress was terrific! Our food was very good. We started off with the pretzel appetizer and yum! Friend had a chicken sandwich served on pretzel bread with fries and I had a house salad. Both were excellent. Food was out pretty quickly. We look forward to going back. Check their website for hours as they are closed several days a week and have lunch and dinner hours. We went at 2pm on a Saturday and it was packed.

data.title: Littlr Austria and Germany in Plano
data.text:
Nice little family run  restaurant with Austrian and German food and of course beers ! Pretzel bread and sausages are very good.
No need to go to Europe but head to old downtown Plano.
Get early to find a place to park !

data.title: Without Equal
data.text:
Having been around the world a time or two, I am a fan of great cuisine, but this was, without a doubt, the best Germanic food I have encountered to-date.

From the sausage to the bread pudding, the flavors were much more refined than I expected.

Two thumbs up!

data.title: Nice Food/Rude Owner
data.text: Totally surprised by loud and rude owner--host ignored our party of 3 and seated others. We recounted the incident to owner expecting an apology and agreement to do a little training for host..but owner basically shouted, you have a seat now..whatever and walked away. Shnitzel was great but won't return.

data.title: First time for Lunch
data.text: Since moving to the DFW area,  I have been looking for a good Austrian restaurant.  Well,  I found it.   Though there is not a lot of seating,  the ambience and food is delightful.   The dining area is decorated with many pictures and memorabilia from Austria.   The wienerschnitzel plate brought me back to having it in Salzburg.   The Stiegl Goldbrau tasted great. The Apple Strudel is a must.   Very good place to go.

data.title: Amazing food
data.text: I have been coming here for years and this visit as with the others was excellent.  The food is great and authentic.  Our waitress was even from Germany.  I highly recommend the pretzels as an appetizer.  My only complaints would be the noise as the restaurant was full and they had quite a wait for a table.

data.title: Couldn't love it more!
data.text: We live a good 50 miles from this restaurant, but we go every month ... incredibly good, authentic German food. Great German beer. Very friendly people. The Oma's Paprika Schnitzel and bread pudding are my favorites!

data.title: Charming
data.text: What a lovely place!!!! Downtown Plano has revived their old downtown area to make it exceedingly nice. Jorg's is there, not only does it incorporate the charm of a revitalized area but the food is terrific as well. As the name tips you off, it is German and oh my, they are fabulous. We each ordered something different and tried a bite of each..........everything was perfect   The spätzle alone is worth going for. Enjoy.

data.title: Loved it
data.text:
A good "foodie friend" of mine took us to dinner here a few weeks ago and it was a thoroughly enjoyable evening. 
The atmosphere is casual, the food very good and the service was great. 
I will be back!

data.title: Amazing Food: Alp-n-Yodel
data.text: We have been going to Jorg's for years. Atmosphere is amazing. Food is very, very authentic. Service is GREAT. REALLY good beer!!! My favorite---the pretzels are the bomb. Dessert---Bread Pudding. Never been a fan of bread pudding, but at Jorg's it is amazing.

data.title: Great German experience
data.text: The atmosphere was authentic. The beer reminded me of Germany. My dinner of Oma's pork schnitzel was okay, not great. The creme brulee was delicious but the bread pudding like dessert was bland (the cream sauce was tasty though).They only had one serving of apelkorn which was disappointing to our table of 12.

data.title: Excellent food and service
data.text: Some friends invited me to meet here while I was in Plano.  I was excited to try the food as lived in Europe while my husband was military.   Austria was one of the countries we visited.  The food didn't disappoint and was just as good as I remember.  Ordered the chicken schnitzel with red cabbage.   It was absolutely delicious.  Served up fresh and hot.  Our young man who waited on us was polite and provided excellent service. No one in our party of 5 was disappointed in their meal.   Can't wait to go here again on next Plano visit.

data.title: Delicious food always!
data.text: Jorg's Cafe Vienna is a full service cafe in the heart of downtown Plano. Walk in through the door from the hustle and bustle of the street and you will find an urban oasis of very welcoming staff in a very homey, casual setting. It's a great place to go as a couple, to bring family or to meet friends. Very laid back inside and always such good service from those that work there. We always go for lunch due to that it much less expensive and the portions tend to be slightly smaller than their dinner portions. My family loves the schnitzel hands down in either Oma's Paprika or the Kaiser Franz Josef sauces. I personally love their braised red cabbage and spaetzle, very savory side dishes! We also recommend Jorg's Wurst Sampler, to try all the different types of traditional sausages. They have a Biergarten that is nice to sit in when the weather cooperates.   Overall this is great place to eat, the food is always delicious no matter what we order.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: We found this restaurant by chance when we visited the Wooden Spoon in Plano, TX. We got lucky and found parking right outside. The place is not big and was pretty full, but we got a table right away. The hostess and the server were very friendly. We ordered Wiener Schnitzel and Jager Schnitzel. Oh, sooooo good!!!! Wish the portions were bigger, but it was lunch after all. The restaurant is covered with Austrian memorabilia, so much fun.
